Content: [dscrdvrsc] <superbig> This is my wallet. I don't know why there are three transactions.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <superbig> The wallet version is up to date

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> How did you get the 21k?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> By the amount of immature balance I‚Äôd guess early mining and investing. ‚úåÔ∏è

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> So if they have an immature balance, they are unable to move those coins right? If the wallet is compromised, then the attacker can try to move them when they mature?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Yes.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> They are in other addresses, but if the whole wallet is compromised then the immature balance is as well.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cragorn> @superbig Only thing he can try to do is to transfer coins as soon as possible after each of the blocks mature. Needs to be faster than the hacker. If not he might lose the rest of the coins (immature) too.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cragorn> Find out how long for each to mature and plan on transfer within minutes of maturing.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> If I were a hacker I would have that automated within seconds. I advice **transferring** all remaining transferable fund to a new wallet on a trusted machine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> Would it be worth moving the wallet to a new machine?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> Or is it more than likely the attacker has the keys

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cragorn> Wont make a difference if he has the wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> That's what I figured, but thought maybe it's someone with another form of access

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Ssh, Remote Desktop in some form....

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Either only that transparent address is compromised (he mentioned paper wallet) or the whole wallet.dat. The later would mean that the immature balance is also compromised and will be game of who is faster to transfer them when they mature.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cragorn> And @Oink has a great point. If this is a hacker with halft a brain he wont spend time waiting for doing this manually, but make a script to run automatically and snag the maturing coins within seconds.

Author: Gateway#3763
